info.author: Jeffrey M. Engelmann
info.description:
# elftools: Engelmann's Libre fMRI Tools

`elftools` is a python package that is intended to facilitate analysis of
functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) datasets.

# Modules

## jfmri: Access MRI/fMRI datasets from files of arbitrary format

`jfmri` (Just Files MRI Module) is an extension module that provides methods
and classes to read MRI/fMRI data from binary files of arbitrary format into
`numpy` arrays, and to write MRI/fMRI data from `numpy` arrays to binary files.
The binary format is specified by the user via command-line arguments, allowing
access to files of any format. There is additional support for reading from and
writing to NIfTI-1 files.

## jfview: View MRI/fMRI datasets

`jfview` (Just Files MRI Viewer) is a simple viewer that is intended for
visualization of how MRI/fMRI datasets are stored on disk without automatically
applying spatial transformations from the image header.

# License

`elftools` is released under the revised (3-clause) BSD license.
For details, see [LICENSE.txt](https://github.com/jme2041/elftools/blob/master/LICENSE.txt).

The NIfTI-1 file format specification and header file (`nifti1.h`) are
available from the
[Neuroimaging Informatics Technology Initiative](https://nifti.nimh.nih.gov).
`nifti1.h` has been released into the public domain.
info.keywords: mri fmri nifti binary file viewer

info.html_description:
elftools: Engelmann's Libre fMRI Tools

elftools is a python package that is intended to facilitate analysis of functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) datasets.

Modules

jfmri: Access MRI/fMRI datasets from files of arbitrary format

jfmri (Just Files MRI Module) is an extension module that provides methods and classes to read MRI/fMRI data from binary files of arbitrary format into numpy arrays, and to write MRI/fMRI data from numpy arrays to binary files. The binary format is specified by the user via command-line arguments, allowing access to files of any format. There is additional support for reading from and writing to NIfTI-1 files.

jfview: View MRI/fMRI datasets

jfview (Just Files MRI Viewer) is a simple viewer that is intended for visualization of how MRI/fMRI datasets are stored on disk without automatically applying spatial transformations from the image header.

License

elftools is released under the revised (3-clause) BSD license. For details, see LICENSE.txt.

The NIfTI-1 file format specification and header file (nifti1.h) are available from the Neuroimaging Informatics Technology Initiative. nifti1.h has been released into the public domain.
